speaker: BOTTOM
text: When my cue comes, call me,

speaker: BOTTOM
text: and I will answer. My next is “Most fair Pyramus.”

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Hey-ho! Peter Quince! Flute the bellows-mender!

speaker: BOTTOM
text: Snout the tinker! Starveling! God’s my life! Stolen

speaker: BOTTOM
text: hence and left me asleep! I have had a most rare

speaker: BOTTOM
text: vision. I have had a dream past the wit of man to say

speaker: BOTTOM
text: what dream it was. Man is but an ass if he go about

speaker: BOTTOM
text: to expound this dream. Methought I was—there

speaker: BOTTOM
text: is no man can tell what. Methought I was and

speaker: BOTTOM
text: methought I had—but man is but a patched fool if

speaker: BOTTOM
text: he will offer to say what methought I had. The eye of

speaker: BOTTOM
text: man hath not heard, the ear of man hath not seen,

speaker: BOTTOM
text: man’s hand is not able to taste, his tongue to

speaker: BOTTOM
text: conceive, nor his heart to report what my dream

speaker: BOTTOM
text: was. I will get Peter Quince to write a ballad of this

speaker: BOTTOM
text: dream. It shall be called “Bottom’s Dream” because

speaker: BOTTOM
text: it hath no bottom; and I will sing it in the

speaker: BOTTOM
text: latter end of a play, before the Duke. Peradventure,

speaker: BOTTOM
text: to make it the more gracious, I shall sing it at her

speaker: BOTTOM
text: death.
